p: The first case of MAYV in Ecuador was identified during a study that took place from 2000 to 2007 ( 16). The patient lived in the city of Guayaquil, in the province of Guayas ( 16). In May of 2019 an epidemiological bulletin released by PAHO reported that an additional five cases of Mayaro were detected in Ecuador ( 38). These cases were identified in samples that tested negative for leptospirosis, dengue, Chikungunya, and Zika ( 38) and that had originated from individuals in the cities of Guayaquil, Babahoyo, Portoviejo, and Santo Domingo ( 38).
